hints.content:
To find the total number of $\text{mL}$, we add the number of $\text{mL}$ of coffee $(\blueD{205} \text { mL})$ to the number of $\text{mL}$ of milk $(\maroonD{25} \text { mL})$.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle is labeled with a question mark. A curved bracket across the top rectangle is labeled Total volume. The bottom rectangle is divided into 2 parts. The longer left part is labeled 205 milliliters. The shorter right part is labeled 25 milliliters. A curved bracket across the longer left part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Coffee. A curved bracket across the shorter right part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Milk. !

hints.content: There are $\greenD{230}\text { mL}$ of liquid in Ella's mom's mug.

question.content:
Ella's mom pours $205$ milliliters of coffee into a mug.  Then she adds $25$ milliliters of milk to her coffee.   

**How many milliliters of liquid are in her mug now?**  

[[☃ input-number 1]] milliliters
